Description: Small Nile silt pottery vessel with globular body, round base, two pierced and flattened tubular handles at the shoulder, and everted rim, coated with blackened slip and burnished. Surface worn in many places. The interior bears traces of a light-brown granular deposit.
Curator's comments: Marked B429 on rim. Black Polished F85 series in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair (exterior worn, rim chipped in many places)
